relation: Great for these types of students
I do online classes, so I would say these classes fit best for contiuning education adults, working adults.
Very reasonable in price. I did my research on online schools and they were the best priced.
I'm in my last year of school, in which you thinks things would be a little liter, but no. These classes and instructors keep you on your toes.
Stay focused and manage your time accordingly.
I absolutely love SNHU. I appreciate the fact that the advisors and instructors are willing to assist you and help in whatever way the can. They help you succeed and graduate.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {180284=If you have a conflict about Instructor offered lower grade just because they can. Especial when you know you are good stand up for your rights. If they ignored your complaints simply contact a legal counselor or attorney's, in which I had to do to request a refund. No way I was accepting a F in Human Sexuality a easy course because of Instructor opinion for grammar. When in-fact I used a word process format and errors checker. You can forget the Dean and COCE will be on-board for the Instructors not you. SNHU is just out for the money not theirs students., 372294=Don't overlook this school if needing to get your BSN or MSN especially if you want an on-line program that continues your nursing education where you left off. The MSN in Nursing Education should be available by the fall of 2016., 275098=I won't lie, SNHU is expensive. We do have lots of scholarships that you can apply for once you get here every January though. The financial aid office is always willing to work with students if money becomes a problem. The money from the student fees goes to funding the clubs, sports teams, etc. So that way the students always have things to do. We are also expanding fast so we have new buildings popping up everywhere like our new library. Definitely discuss money with your guardian or if you are on your own make sure to meet with the One Stop staff to discuss your options., 356510=I am a transfer student and will start classes Jan 13th. The advisers are absolutely amazing.The campus is also beautiful!, 288122=Starting first class in March however, talking with registration and my adviser they have displayed a passion for success., 380378=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 138311=Southern New Hampshire University is a close-knit school that truly cares and recognizes the talents of each and every student. They are more of a community than a school, but there is still a learning and growing opportunity in every direction one looks. Between the success of graduates, the beautiful campus that is constantly being renovated in order to look even newer than it already does, and the fact that it's the only school that got placed on Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies 2012, it is almost impossible to go wrong at SNHU., 286776=I am looking forward to starting on March 3. I will be an online student and so far from what I have gathered from talking to several individuals in registration, adviser and financial aid they all have been fantastic!!!!!!, 334185=I enrolled in SNHU in 2012 and I have love it from the very beginning. The staff is very warm and friendly, plus they are all knowledgeable. The professors are well versed and fair, and I am looking forward to my next course., 181030=My suggestion afterward experience at this particular University. I wouldn't recommended any student to SNHU, they are cruel when it comes to Instructor inapproachable response. They make student feeling horrible in grammar errors or punctually. The worst University I have ever attended hybrid online. If you've been out a longer time and warming up forget it like a conspiracy's.}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students I am a commuter so SNHU is great for that! I get 2,000 dollars to commute and I am still in all of the activities on and off of campus! SNHU is also great if you live on campus, everything ia really close and the dorms are very clean and the staff is great to work with! Tips for prospective students Visit campus so that you can get a feel for the dorms, they are all so different! Also check with your high school guidance counselor to see if there are any special programs your high school is doing with SNHU. Bang for the buck Even though tuition was raised a little this year, i still feel as if it is my best opportunity, and i really am getting what i pay for! Am enjoying being here I love being at SNHU, the environment is great! The clubs on campus really put on alot of activities and chances to meet other students, and on campus generally everyone is really nice! Am learning a lot I would definately say I am learning alot!
